title: Wordnik
description: Wordnik is the world's biggest online English dictionary, by number of words

actions.title: getApiTokenStatus
actions.description: Returns usage statistics for the API account.

actions.title: getLoggedInUser
actions.description: Requires a valid auth_token to be set.

auth_token.description: The auth token of the logged-in user, obtained by calling /account.{format}/authenticate/{username} (described above)

actions.title: getWordListsForLoggedInUser
actions.description: Fetches WordList objects for the logged-in user.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.title: getWord
actions.description: Given a word as a string, returns the WordObject that represents it

word.description: String value of WordObject to return

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

includeSuggestions.description: Return suggestions (for correct spelling, case variants, etc.)

actions.title: getAudio
actions.description: The metadata includes a time-expiring fileUrl which allows reading the audio file directly from the API.  Currently only audio pronunciations from the American Heritage Dictionary in mp3 format are supported.

useCanonical.description: Use the canonical form of the word

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return
Maximum number of results to return

sourceDictionaries.description: Source dictionary to return definitions from.  If 'all' is received, results are returned from all sources. If multiple values are received (e.g. 'century,wiktionary'), results are returned from the first specified dictionary that has definitions. If left blank, results are returned from the first dictionary that has definitions. By default, dictionaries are searched in this order: ahd, wiktionary, webster, century, wordnet

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

includeTags.description: Return a closed set of XML tags in response

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

includeDuplicates.description: Show duplicate examples from different sources

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

actions.title: getHyphenation
actions.description: Returns syllable information for a word

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return a correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

sourceDictionary.description: Get from a single dictionary. Valid options: ahd, century, wiktionary, webster, and wordnet.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.title: getPhrases
actions.description: Fetches bi-gram phrases for a word

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

actions.title: getTextPronunciations
actions.description: Returns text pronunciations for a given word

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return a correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.title: getRelatedWords
actions.description: Given a word as a string, returns relationships from the Word Graph

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

relationshipTypes.description: Limits the total results per type of relationship type

limitPerRelationshipType.description: Restrict to the supplied relationship types

actions.title: getTopExample
actions.description: Returns a top example for a word

useCanonical.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

actions.title: getRandomWords
actions.description: Returns an array of random WordObjects

includeSourceDictionaries.description: Only include these comma-delimited source dictionaries

excludePartOfSpeech.description: Exclude these comma-delimited parts of speech
